data.title: Moving from animation loop to a static frame

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Incorporate Some of the batbuild Changes

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
The [batbuild fork](https://github.com/batbuild/duality) of Duality recently incorporated some interesting changes for improving performance and memory footprint. Since this is done on an old and heavily modified Duality version, being able to merge changes directly might be a rare luxury, but they could nevertheless be considered for manually implementing similar changes to the master branch. Some of them _do_ seem quite interesting.

Some examples:
- [ ] TexSubImage: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/907d5b33eead239f616a75e08183e6d85d4e6950
- [ ] Texture.Clear: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/1d552360d57523e96b54799953895880a769de3a
- [x] GameObject.GetChildrenDeep: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/6f311c3c2ae5aadf3e46120ca07719989bb0c0f6
- [x] Some LINQ Removal: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/f3da098c49b15ece05e4d42e5ff1d7dcbdd1eab3
- [x] Renderer Active Check: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/b30acf2b454a59f67b22208b822bd0546ee81a50
- [x] Camera Z Sorting: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/118007f1fb41593fa3b8722f6b6b2ab40e9c7e73
- [x] RigidBody Transform Updates: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/0f93fe7a77276d8c76620e5f92cd13757c77fada
- [ ] UpdateAbsChild: https://github.com/batbuild/duality/commit/963ef89217cc7f525e30d5f65f42cb8c7d49c692

cc @BraveSirAndrew to make sure this is fine for everyone before shamelessly grabbing code.

data.title: Make the Deployment Process Easier

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Right now, the deployment process is as follows:
1. [Implement and thoroughly test a feature in the master branch.]
2. Create a distinct [Package Update](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/commit/a1023558baddd6664727001a73b264f02da8ca46) commit where all affected NuGet package specs are updated, as well as their dependencies and the corresponding AssemblyInfo files.
3. Merge `master` into `release`. AppVeyor will build the binaries.
4. Log into AppVeyor, go to `Environments / Duality NuGet Package Release`, click `Update` and select the latest merge commit into `release`.

The obvious problem is in the Package Update step, which is just a lot of manual work that could easily be automated using a command line tool. Ideas for such a command line tool:
- It should be executed manually on the developer's machine who does the `Package Update` commit.
- It could scan the directory structure and automatically determine the projects that are affected by the sum of all commits since the last `Package Update` commit in git history.
- For each affected project, the appropriate git commit messages can be retrieved and condensed into each package's release notes. They can be added to the nuspec automatically.
- The tool would then display a list of commits for each affected project and ask whether this should be considered a major, minor or patch update. The appropriate version number can be incremented.
- The version numbers in both nuspecs and AssemblyInfo files are updated accordingly.

This would streamline the binary release process. It would also make it a lot more failsafe and easier for other developers (who might be entering the future core team of Duality) to grasp.

data.title: Consider Rewriting CanvasState Vertex Transformation

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
In the current implementation the `Canvas` convenience class is not able to express complex (stacked) and arbitrary vertex transformations. It relies on a hardcoded triple of offset, rotation and scale and is always performed locally on the currently drawn shape.

Consider extending / changing transformation support to
1. operate on the global coordinate system, not each shape's local system and 
2. allow arbitrary and complex transformations.

Both could potentially be achieved by switching to a matrix stack.

data.title: Project name in Title bar of Duality Editor window

data.body:
Currently the title of the Duality Editor window is "Dualitor" (see attached image).

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11983537/12376384/5f9225cc-bd45-11e5-81e0-68914bf1c638.png)

With two or more projects open it would be nice to see the project name in the window title bar so the correct editor can be selected. Not a big deal but would be nice to have.

data.title: Find a Way to Deal With CamView "MouseOver HotKeys"

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Keyboard focus handling in the CamView is currently less than ideal. 

For some workflows, users switch often between using the CamView and other controls, leading to a frequent input focus change. When returning to the CamView (with the mouse cursor), users may often press a hotkey directly and naturally expect it to work - however, as input focus is still on the last used control and no click occurred, the CamView is unable to react. One of these cases is the usage of the "hold space bar" camera navigation, some others emerge with [tilemap editing](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/249).

A global event hook to capture input whenever the mouse cursor is above the CamView is not a solution, because users may as well hover it inadvertently while using a textbox or similar elsewhere. Right now, the space bar is captured this way, combined with a few hacks to prevent some of the bad cases from happening. This, however, is not a good solution and it can only work reliably, because space is rarely the first character in keyboard input.

In all other cases, users will currently have to manually focus the CamView in order to be able to use CamViewState-specific hotkeys. This is usually done by clicking the middle mouse button, but it's definitely not ideal this way.

Investigate solutions to this problem.

data.title: Investigate Editor-Only "Load From Remote Sources" Exception

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As described [here](), Assemblies that have been marked as web-unsafe fail to load in the editor, but not the launcher. It is possible that this behavior is also dependent on the .Net Framework version that is running Duality.

One potential cause for this is the fact that the [launcher explicitly allows](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/master/DualityLauncher/App.config) loading from remote sources in its App.config file, whereas [the editor doesn't](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/master/DualityEditor/app.config). Synchronizing them both to allow loading from remote sources seems like a reasonable course of action.

data.title: Investigate CCD accuracy in physics simulation

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Continuous Collision Detection(CCD) is meant to handle cases of fast moving objects that can leap over an obstacle in normal physics simulation. However, as mentioned in this thread 
http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=668, CCD is not behaving as expected and doesn't seem to produce behavior different from regular physics simulation.

data.title: Scene contents are deleted when saving fails and Sandbox is ran

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Initialize Component Editor Actions
data.body:
Implemented support for EditorActions that are responsible for initializing Component's specifically for use within the editor. 

These editor actions are called from within the CreateComponent UndoRedoAction. They were placed there because they would otherwise need to be called and managed by any third-party plugin that was making use of them, but I believe the usefulness of editor actions largely stems from their ease of integration between third-party and Duality code. And since CreateComponent is an editor related action anyways, it seems acceptable to have them placed there. If this becomes a point of dispute, it is trivial to move the calls somewhere else.

The change to the default value of Rigidbody.shapes is due to null reference exceptions that are thrown due to the change in initialization process.

This PR fixes issue #261.

data.title: Keep the dragging of Rigidbodies between objects from adding the default circle

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Currently, if you drag a Rigidbody from one GameObject to another, it will add the default circle shape to the rigidbody. Steps to reproduce:
1. Create two empty GameObjects, A and B
2. Add a Rigidbody to object A
3. Replace the default circle collision shape with something else.
4. Drag and drop the Rigidbody and Transform from object A onto object B

Now if you look in the Rigidbody editor, you should see that it kept the shape we replaced the default shape with, but it re-added the default circle.

I'm assuming that this is because the Rigidbody is re-created rather than moved, and during it's construction the default circle is added. However, I also noticed that cloning a GameObject does not add back-in that default circle, so the functionality already exists somewhere to re-create the Rigidbody without adding that default circle.

data.title: Added the ability to add components to multiple selected GameObjects

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
What I had to do:

1) Removed the check for a single selection when deciding if the "new" context menu item should be shown
2) Looped over the SelectedNodes property rather than just SelectedNode. This forced me to track the added nodes so that we could select them later. Selecting them inside the foreach loop would have modified the enumerable.

I checked and verified that this does not overwrite Component's if they already exist on a GameObject.

data.title: Highlight values in the Object Inspector on double-click

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
In almost any text interface, such as the editor used to write this, double clicking a word or number will highlight that word or number, allowing you to quickly replace it. However, this currently does not occur in the Object Inspector when you double click a value, which makes the inspector text fields behave differently than in most other UI's.

This is by no means a big deal, but I think it would be a nice usability feature.

data.title: Large world support
data.body:
Hey,
I am working on a 2D project in Unreal 4 that is fairly big in terms of world size. I am looking to port it away from Unreal 4 due to the fact that 2D support is not all that good at the moment in terms of performance.

That said - I have been trying to get large world support working in Duality for a day or two now. No real progress on my end.

[This](http://xboxforums.create.msdn.com/forums/p/111091/663342.aspx#663342) should provide more context for what I want.

To sum it up:

![Image 1](http://www.xnafan.net/downloads/_tutorials/InfiniteWorld/infinite-worlds_01.png)

The world is broken up into a series of Chunks / sub levels.

![Image 2](http://www.xnafan.net/downloads/_tutorials/InfiniteWorld/infinite-worlds_02.png)

When a player loads or starts the game - It should load the map that the player is currently in and buffer the maps that are adjacent to the player. As well as unload any maps as needed.

![Image 3](http://www.xnafan.net/downloads/_tutorials/InfiniteWorld/infinite-worlds_03.png)

If the players view enters any adjacent level chunks then it should render them.

![Image 4](http://www.xnafan.net/downloads/_tutorials/InfiniteWorld/infinite-worlds_04.png)

The rest of this should be self explanatory.

This should all be handled from some form of GUI for ease of use for artists.

I am not sure how feasible this is at the moment for Duality but It is something that I would like to see and would contribute too as I learn more.

data.title: Deal with Duality Physics Units

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
Right now, Duality converts all physics units from Farseer (SI units) to its own. This was introduced to account for the fact, that one Duality length unit equals one pixel in default Camera settings, which would result in objects being far too large in Farseer. Similarly, conversions for mass and time were introduced. In order to keep it all consistent, Duality converts [not only lengths, durations and masses, but _all_ units](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/2f648f4874b8b3f82aff059324ab5e3382c62500/Source/Core/Duality/Utility/Math/PhysicsConvert.cs).

For most of these conversions, the resulting values are still in a reasonable range. However, when it comes to Inertia (kg*m), the conversion to Duality usually yields values around 1.000.000, which is far too high - especially given the fact that they're stored as floats.

Problems that arise from this:
- Custom physics calculations can fail due to precision issues when performed in the wrong order.
- It feels counter-intuitive to deal with values that high, seems "wrong" to the average user.

These problems should be addressed, though unfortunately, this is a breaking change that requires a major version step:
- `PhysicsConvert` exposes a set of constants, requiring all dependent plugins and libraries to be recompile on change.
- Explicit `Mass` values for RigidBodies are serialized in Duality units, thus are interpreted wrong when changing the underlying conversion ratios.

Even though it is, at this point, unclear how to solve this issue the best way, the system should be adjusted to make changes possible without breaking anything:
- `PhysicsConvert` should be a set of static readonly values rather than constants.
- Store explicit mass and inertia values in Farseer units, not Duality units.

The above should be implemented regardless of the actual solution to the problem.

data.title: Find a way to Recover from Incompatible Plugin Exceptions

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Right now, installing an incompatible or faulty plugin can lead to the editor not being able to start up again due to a `TypeLoadException` being thrown, as seen [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=3706#p3706). This is very unfortunate.

Find a way to recover from this, discard the faulty plugin and go on without problems. Both editor and core plugins.

data.title: Output CPU type, (available) video memory in logfile.txt.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
It wouldn't hurt, would it?

I know that the processor count is already output, but CPU type could also be output (for example, Intel i7-4790K).

By video memory, I mean the GPU's dedicated memory (shared memory is not important, I think?). If possible, only the available amount could be output. (EDIT: Now that I think about it, total amount may also be useful?)

However, I understand these may be hard to implement, even if they sound simple. In that case, disregard this. The same information can be obtained in other ways (the person with a problem could manually provide it).

data.title: Create a Tilemap Plugin

milestone.title: Tilemaps Plugin v1.0
milestone.description: Implement a rectangular 2D tilemap plugin.

data.body:
Tilemaps are an incredibly easy way to create game worlds in 2D games, used in platformers, topdown games, strategy games, etc., so it might be worth considering to create an "official" tilemap implementation - especially since it has often been asked how to do this.

Some early (personal) notes on the topic as a reminder for myself:
![notes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/11149513/7db23506-8a23-11e5-8b0e-3bb299718003.jpg)

Sorry for the bad image quality - I will transcribe the most vital information into (generally) readable text when requested or while iterating on it.

data.title: SVG import support.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I was just wondering whether SVG support is planned for Duality? Or is it not making it in?

If it isn't making it in, how much work would it take for someone to make an SVG importer? If it's not too hard I could try it, however limited my skills may be. Anyone else could also give it a go (nudge nudge).

data.title: Duality editor does not remember Camera View settings

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
A small issue I just thought of putting up here.

When you create a new Camera View in the editor, change it's view type (for example, to Game View) then restart the editor, it does not remember the new setting. It's not much of a hindrance, but it gets annoying after a time, since I like to have a Scene View/RigidBody Editor and Game View workflow, so I can easily test changes in the user's perspective.

data.title: WAV audio importer

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Feature Request: I'd like to see a built in WAV importer. Vorbis/mp3 is fine for long music tracks and ambiences, but most sound designers are used to working with lossless WAVs, so manually converting to compressed formats every time will be a big workflow impediment.

Duality could compress internally to optimise memory requirements (with exposed compression level controls of course).

data.title: PropertyGrid List View Doesn't Invalidate Properly

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
See [this forum post](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=602).
- When expanding a list item node in the propertygrid, closing it again, then adjusting the offset, its visual representation won't be updated properly. Opening it again still shows the value at the old offset.
- This can be "fixed" when adjusting the offset while the item is open, which will update the controls properly.

This can potentially be fixed by invalidating the child editor cache for list editor items when adjusting the offset.

data.title: Automatically expand components in Object Inspector

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I feel like this is a personal issue, but I'll suggest a solution in case anyone agrees with me.

I get annoyed when I load up my Duality project, and I have to expand all the components from the selected GameObject in the Object Inspector.

Perhaps there should be an option to auto expand the components, or just save their state, so if I expand one component, save, close and reopen the editor, the component is still expanded.
